title: React JS - Part 2
content:
- List and key
```
	- React requires a locally unique key to be used for rendering arrays, to be able to detect when element was changed, added or deleted.
	- If that object has an Id, and might change values during lifetime - use Id. In this case id is the only way to let React know, that this "new" object is that "old" object.
	- If that object doesn't has an Id, or it is constant - don't use Id. You have an item. Item itself IS THE KEY. But you cant use "object" as a key, as long key should be a string. But you can convert it to string. An unique string
    - Keys Must Only Be Unique Among Siblings
```
